document.docAuthor: Zhu, Wenhui, Yao, Zhiyuan, Zheng, Guo & Li, Shuqiang
document.docTitle: Belisana guilin Zhu & Yao & Zheng & Li 2020, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Six new species of the spider genus Belisana Thorell, 1898 (Araneae: Pholcidae) from southern China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Six new species of the spider genus Belisana Thorell, 1898 (Araneae: Pholcidae) from southern China

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material.
Holotype :
Male ( IZCAS Ar39846), Unnamed cave ( 25°12’56.00”N , 110°09’17.90”E ,
elevation 144 m
), S306 Provincial Road , 30 meters east of Feihulinju , Lingui District , Guilin ,
Guangxi
,
China
,
6 December 2012
, Z. Chen and Z. Zhao leg.
Paratypes :
1 male ( IZCAS Ar39847) and
2 females ( IZCAS Ar39848–39849), same data as holotype
.
Etymology. The specific name refers to the type locality and is a noun in apposition.

Diagnosis. This species resembles
B. longinqua Zhang & Peng, 2011
(see Zhang & Peng 2011: 58 , fig. 5, male only) with similar male chelicerae ( Fig. 2D ) and bulbal apophyses ( Fig. 2C ) and resembles
B. colubrina Zhang & Peng, 2011
(see Zhang & Peng 2011: 64 , fig. 9) with similar bulbal apophyses ( Fig. 2C ) and external female genitalia ( Figs 2A , 14A ), but can be distinguished by presence of large, disto-prolateral membranous lamella (arrow 1 in Figs 1C , 13A ) and protruding subdisto-dorsal sclerite (arrow 2 in Figs 1C , 13A ) on procursus, by short retrolatero-ventral apophysis of male pedipalpal trochanter ( Fig. 1B ), and by absence of marks on carapace ( Fig. 2E ); also distinguished from
B. longinqua
by presence of small proximo-dorsal hump on male pedipalpal femur (arrow in Fig. 1B ) and from
B. colubrina
by male cheliceral distal apophyses directed toward downward (arrow da in Fig. 2D ) and vulval pore plates not strongly curved (arrow pp in Figs 2B , 14B ).

Description. Male (
holotype
, IZCAS Ar39846): Total length 1.68 (1.78 with clypeus), carapace 0.74 long, 0.68 wide, opisthosoma 0.94 long, 0.90 wide. Leg I: 16.84 (4.10 + 0.43 + 4.62 + 6.41 + 1.28), leg II: 10.89 (3.01 + 0.38 + 2.69 + 4.17 + 0.64), leg III: 7.44 (2.12 + 0.26 + 1.86 + 2.49 + 0.71), leg IV: 10.07 (3.27 + 0.32 + 2.44 + 3.27 + 0.77); tibia I L/d: 74. Distance PME-PME 0.09, diameter PME 0.06, distance PME-ALE 0.03, AME absent. Sternum slightly wider than long (0.60/0.50). Habitus as in Figs 2 E–F. Carapace and sternum pale, without marks. Legs pale, without darker rings. Opisthosoma yellowish white, without spots. Ocular area not elevated. Thoracic furrow absent. Clypeus unmodified. Chelicerae ( Fig. 2D ) with pair of small proximo-lateral apophyses and pair of long, curved distal apophyses (distance between tips of distal apophyses: 0.31). Pedipalps as in Figs 1 A–B; coxa unmodified; trochanter with short retrolatero-ventral apophysis; femur with small proximo-dorsal hump (arrow in Fig. 1B ); procursus ( Figs 1 A–D, 13A–B) simple proximally but complex distally, with large, disto-prolateral membranous lamella (arrow 1 in Figs 1C , 13A ), small subdisto-dorsal sclerite (arrow 2 in Figs 1C , 13A ), large subdistoprolateral sclerite (arrow 3 in Figs 1C , 13A ), curved distal spine and large retrolateral membranous flap (arrow f in Figs 1D , 13B ); bulb ( Fig. 2C ) with long hooked apophysis and simple embolus. Retrolateral trichobothria of tibia I at 10% proximally; legs with short vertical setae on metatarsi, without spines and curved setae; tarsus I with 24 distinct pseudosegments.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1.
Belisana guilin
sp. nov.
, holotype male. A–B. Pedipalp (A. Prolateral view; B. Retrolateral view, arrow points at proximo-dorsal hump on pedipalpal femur); C–D. Distal part of procursus (C. Prolateral view, arrow 1 points at disto-prolateral membranous lamella, arrow 2 points at small subdisto-dorsal sclerite, arrow 3 points at large subdisto-prolateral sclerite; D. Retrolateral view). b = bulb, ba = bulbal apophysis, e = embolus, f = flap, pr = procursus. Scale bars: 0.05 (A–B), 0.02 (C–D).

FIGURE 2.
Belisana guilin
sp. nov.
, holotype male (C–F) and paratype female (A–B, G–H). A. External female genitalia, ventral view; B. Vulva, dorsal view; C. Bulb, prolateral view; D. Chelicerae, frontal view; E–H. Habitus (E, G. Dorsal view; F. Lateral view; H. Ventral view). b = bulb, ba = bulbal apophysis, da = distal apophysis, e = embolus, ep = frontal “epigynal” pocket, pa = proximo-lateral apophysis, pp = pore plate. Scale bars: 0.05 (A–D), 0.30 (E–H).

subSubSection.paragraph: Female (IZCAS Ar39848): Similar to male, habitus as in Figs 2 G–H. Total length 1.50 (1.66 with clypeus), carapace 0.56 long, 0.63 wide, opisthosoma 0.94 long, 0.94 wide. Tibia I: 2.88; tibia I L/d: 58. Distance PME-PME 0.08, diameter PME 0.04, distance PME-ALE 0.03, AME absent. Sternum approximately as wide as long (0.47). External female genitalia ( Figs 2A , 14A ) simple and flat, with pair of frontal “epigynal” pockets postero-laterally on scletotized plate (arrow ep in Figs 2 A–B, 14A–B), 0.28 apart. Vulva ( Figs 2B , 14B ) with roof-shaped anterior arch and pair of long, narrow pore plates (arrow pp in Figs 2B , 14B ), without serrated sclerites.

Variation:
Tibia I in male paratype ( IZCAS Ar39847): 3.98. Tibia I in another female paratype ( IZCAS Ar39849): 2.88
.
Natural history. The species was found underside of rocks in the aphotic zone inside the cave.
Distribution. China ( Guangxi , type locality only; Fig. 15 ).
